<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class TestStringTokenStrict {
```csharp
/**
 * Strict implementation of StringTokenizer
 * 
 * @param str
 * @param delim
 * @param strict
 *            true = include NULL Token
 * @return
 */
static StringTokenizer getStringTokenizerStrict(String str, String delim, boolean strict) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str, delim, strict);
    StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();

    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        String s = st.nextToken();
        if (s.equals(delim)) {
            sb.append(" ").append(delim);
        } else {
            sb.append(s).append(delim);
            if (st.hasMoreTokens())
                st.nextToken();
        }
    }
    return (new StringTokenizer(sb.toString(), delim));
}

static void altStringTokenizer(StringTokenizer st) {
    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        String type = st.nextToken();
        String one = st.nextToken();
        String two = st.nextToken();
        String three = st.nextToken();
        String four = st.nextToken();
        String five = st.nextToken();

        System.out.println(
                "[" + type + "] [" + one + "] [" + two + "] [" + three + "] [" + four + "] [" + five + "]");
    }
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    String input = "Record|One||Three||Five";
    altStringTokenizer(getStringTokenizerStrict(input, "|", true));
}
```
}

<<<explanation>>>: The code provided is a Java program that uses the StringTokenizer class to tokenize a given string based on a delimiter. The program also includes a strict implementation of the StringTokenizer class that includes NULL tokens in the tokenization process. The main function of the program takes two arguments: the input string and the delimiter used to tokenize the string. The program then calls the altStringTokenizer function, which tokenizes the input string using the StringTokenizer class and prints the tokens in a specific format.

To answer the question of how to read empty fields in the StringTokenizer class, the program provides a strict implementation of the StringTokenizer class that includes NULL tokens in the tokenization process. This implementation ensures that all tokens, including empty tokens, are included in the tokenization process. Therefore, the empty fields in the input string are correctly read and printed by the program.
